page.title: 01INTRODUCTION DUNSFORD AREA
page.content: This area is dominated by the River Teign which enters from the west through a deep wooded gorge.The river banks are kept as a nature reserve with public paths.It is a noted beauty spot,especially in spring when covered with wild daffodils.The route from Exeter to Dartmoor passes through from east to west and the river was best forded through shallows at the end of the gorge.The nearby picturesque village of Dunsford is believed to take it's name from the ford in the woods.The surrounding area is mainly intensively managed grassland with patches of woodland and some crops.The farms are generally about 100-300acres.The land is hilly but with a wide strip of flat pasture by the side of the river.
